comment.author: 72718192@N00
comment._content: I believe Capt. Ponsonby committed the Murder with the Poisoned Red Wine in the Library at 2:30pm, but that is my theory.. It was a posh killing so a young Hercule Poirot who was, conveniently, on holiday nearby, was able to solve the mystery without any publicity.

comment._content: Royal House Party? Times have changed for sure, a house party these days wouldn't be so stuffy....

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: I met a Mr. Fortescue at an EU conference some years ago and we joked about how the French interpreters mangled his name.  It turned out he was Anglo Irish and his family went way back here. He had fluent Irish and we joked about the EU's pronunciation of the Oisin programme, he was one of the few who could do so properly.  Could he be related to our Capt. Fortescue RN????
